intro: Antirrhinum serpyllifolium, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine绒毛, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, grassy areas and is often found in meadows and along pathways. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it is considered a valuable plant for supporting biodiversity in its native habitats.
